h2.span: IMAGINE MADISON AVENUE SCHOOL OF ARTS

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

span.span: Imagine Madison Ave. School of Arts serving grades K-5

font.span: Imagine Madison Avenue School of the Arts, in partnership with our families and the community, will assure that all children learn at high levels. Students will be prepared academically, artistically, and emotionally for their future life endeavors.

strong.font: Following the mandate from Ohio Gov. Mike Dewine, Imagine Madison Avenue School of Arts will be closed until May 1st. It has been determined that closing schools will be an effective way to disrupt widespread infection of the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19).

Important Update: Imagine Madison will be serving grab and go lunches to any children under 18 during the closure effective March 17th - May 1st. Lunch will be served on site at 1511 Madison Avenue from 11:00-12:30 daily. We will also be delivering meals, Please call the main office for

Important Update: Student work assignments and distance learning resources will be sent (via mail) starting the week of April 6th. Please call the main office and let us know if your address has changed.

font.br:
Mrs. Lindsey Day
Grades Served:
K-5 Serving Toledo and Surrounding Area

span.font: Academic Growth defines our strong belief that students’ progress toward proficiency and beyond is the most accurate indicator both of a student’s and a school’s academic strength. It is imperative that every Imagine student develops the skills and habits for successful learning. Imagine educators, students, parents, and board members support and adhere to the Imagine Schools Academic Excellence Framework, which specifies increased rigor, focus, effectiveness, and accountability. This Framework includes an expectation that every student will reach or exceed grade level proficiency within three or fewer years while attending an Imagine School. Imagine educators design their instruction to empower each student to make significant academic progress that is both measured and celebrated.

em.strong: Happy are those who dream dreams and
are ready to pay the price to make them come true.
